intro: Pimpinella urceolata, commonly known as the bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, rounded leaflets. Pimpinella urceolata is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
